From:
 Kaitlin Nonweiler
Sent:
 Wednesday, April 2, 2025 11:36 AM
To:
 Chuck Adams
Subject:
 IDI QA Email Address 
Hi Chuck. I am working on adding users to the LCW IDI organization account. Can you provide me with the email address you used to register as an IDI QA? 
The IDI support removed Monica as the Account Owner and made me the account owner (FYI I did not ask for this to be done). Once I add you as a user, I can ask IDI support to make you the account owner. 
See the list below of all the users and their roles. I am working on adding you and Andrea as users. Does Randall need to be removed as a user? Also, there are two types of roles- Account Admin and QA Member (see pic below of description). I would recommend making any user an admin who will be taking over any of my duties. 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Organize your day with Outlook
body:
Use Outlook for easier communication and scheduling. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Streamline your day with Outlook
Getting organized is easy with Outlook, which is included in Microsoft 365. Send emails, schedule meetings, attach files from the cloud, and track tasks—all in one place. 
 
Open Outlook
 
‌
Add your email account to Outlook
It only takes a few minutes to add one or more email accounts to Outlook. Then, personalize your experience by creating custom email signatures, sharing your calendar, and adding contacts. 
Learn more
 
 
‌
Keep your account secure with multifactor authentication
Protect your work with an extra layer of security. Set up multifactor authentication to ensure only you can access your Microsoft 365 account. 
Learn more

subject: Share your AP experiences!
body:
Hi Kaitlin,
We want to know about your financial back office experiences, and especially about Accounts Payable!  The survey should take less than 10 (ten) minutes to complete.
Everyone who is eligible and completes the survey will be entered to win one of five (5) $200 e-gift cards.  Full details at 
Survey sweepstakes 3-2025
   
The link below is only for you, and will only work once, so please do not share it with others.
Thanks in advance for your time!
Click the link below or paste the URL into your internet browser:
https://bill.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_8c3o57LxtCpRBJk?Q_DL=iiRZhUgtGrCQ5wB_8c3o57LxtCpRBJk_CGC_ZfoSqXzAAF8byWU&Q_CHL=email&samp=1
Follow the link to opt out of future emails:
Click here to unsubscribe
_________________________________________________________________________________
Jen Plebani
Director, Product Research

subject: Re: A few things
body:
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 26, 2025 7:52 PM
To:
 Kaitlin Nonweiler <k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: A few things
 
 
OK great, thank you Kaitlin!
If for some reason you can't connect with Juri, I know how to do the evals & get the QR codes. I think I know how to add an event to Scoro. And I think the team can probably handle Zoom stuff - at least I hope.
Am I missing something else we should know (in case you and Juri are unavailable)?
From:
 Kaitlin Nonweiler <k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 26, 2025 6:02 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: A few things
 
 
Good afternoon!
All registrants for the webinar tomorrow have been added. I'll be looking for stragglers. 
Plan to look at calendars today to schedule an IDI call with Chuck, Andrea, and RP.
Yes, Juri has been OOO, but hopefully soon I can catch up with her. 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 25, 2025 8:36 AM
To:
 Kaitlin Nonweiler <k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 A few things
 
 
Good morning, Kaitlin! How are you feeling?
Just a few things for you....
I plan on sending you the registration list for this Thursday's webinar on Wed around 4 or 5pm ET.
Have you scheduled an IDI call with Chuck, Andrea, RP?
Have you scheduled something with Juri to walk her through what you do so she can assist while you're out? She has been a bit unavailable because of some personal issues.
Thank you!
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

body:

Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
LCW
 
 
From:
 Kaitlin Nonweiler <k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 26, 2025 6:45 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Juri Mansour <j.mansour@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Edit to Group M course evaluation survey 
 
Hi! No worries at all. 
 
Here are the links, although they did NOT change. If you sent the link to the client, it is still the same. Anytime you change or edit a survey, the links will stay the same. However, the QR will be different (see attached). 
 
Link for client:
https://forms.office.com/r/KugkG5NnZ2
 
Collaboration links for consultants to review survey results and edit:
https://forms.office.com/Pages/DesignPageV2.aspx?subpage=design&FormId=QgqkPC3XyUO5LgdAEB2d0_ue_HuVluNLjeZ6GrTTrTtUNEw5RUJINk40TUNSUDNBN0E0WVVUQzE3Ty4u&Token=2ced0bce742f45039b04fd1ee1924a12
From:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 26, 2025 12:46 PM
To:
 Kaitlin Nonweiler <
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Juri Mansour <
j.mansour@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Edit to Group M course evaluation survey 
 
Hi Kaitlin, thanks for your patience with all my recent emails!
Anyway, I just noticed that the name of the session associated with this course evaluation needs to change. The name of the workshop is “Building an Inclusive GroupM Culture”. Is it possible for you to change it on the survey and also on the QR code and then send us a new one?
THANK YOU!
RP
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
LCW

Subject:
 Re: Group M evaluation QR code
 
I added a question to the survey (see below) where they select the date from a calendar. I'm not sure we can isolate the responses based on the answer to one question within Microsoft Forms, BUT we can by downloading the excel spreadsheet. Does this look like what you envisioned?
 
Rebecca, I'm feeling good... some lower back pain, but I'm still teaching Zumba twice a week and going to yoga. I will say hello 
👶
Thank you so much for checking in! 
❣

, so we could cut the data by date? Where they select the date from a calendar or a drop down vs. them writing it in? 
 
Thanks again, KN! How are you feeling??? Say hello to baby for me!

Hi friends, 
 
I've included my process at the bottom on this email. This is the process I follow, unless a consultant chooses to use their own Office Microsoft account to make the survey. 
 
Juri and Rebecca, see the QR code (attached) and the links below for the GroupM sessions. To clarify, you are using just one survey/evaluation for all sessions?
 
Post-Session Survey link to share with client: 
https://forms.office.com/r/KugkG5NnZ2
 
You can access the Post-Session Survey using this link to make changes and view results – you are a collaborator:
https://forms.office.com/Pages/DesignPageV2.aspx?subpage=design&FormId=QgqkPC3XyUO5LgdAEB2d0_ue_HuVluNLjeZ6GrTTrTtUNEw5RUJINk40TUNSUDNBN0E0WVVUQzE3Ty4u&Token=2ced0bce742f45039b04fd1ee1924a12
 
My process
Consultant sends the Scheduling Template to Kaitlin indicating if an evaluation QR code and link is needed
Kaitlin creates the evaluation form in her Office Microsoft Forms account
Kaitlin sends the consultant an email (see template below) will the QR code and links (Zoom, survey link for client, collaboration link)
Hi (consultant) ,
Here are the links and QR code for the Date - Client Name: Session Name 
Zoom Link:
You can access the Post-Session Survey using this link to make changes and view results – you are a collaborator:
Post-Session Survey link to share with client:

From:
 Kaitlin Nonweiler <k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 26, 2025 6:36 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Juri Mansour <j.mansour@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: GroupM - couple Zoom questions
 
Hi Rebecca! Sounds good to me. 
 
Yes, Zoom has three options- option 2 'attendees need to register for each occurence to attend' Registrants need to register separately for each occurrence to attend. They can only choose one date and time on the registrant page.would fit best as that option only allows a participant to register for a single session only. registrant cancels, they will need to re-register to attend any future sessions. 
2. Registrant cancellations: I did not receive an email saying that you cancelled. I researched it, and it looks like Zoom does NOT send an email to the host when a registrant cancels their registration. The host has to manually check the registrant list within the Zoom web portal to see who has cancelled. 
 
From:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 26, 2025 9:32 AM
To:
 Kaitlin Nonweiler <
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Juri Mansour <
j.mansour@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 GroupM - couple Zoom questions
 
 
Hi Kaitlin, thank you so much for your help in finalizing our session scheduling process with Group M. 
 
GroupM will be sending out registration links for eight sessions at a time, just like you did for the test run last week. 
 
We met with them today and they have two additional questions.
 
Is LCW able to set up the registration link on the back end such that any given email (participant) can register for a 
single session only
 and is prevented from registering for more multiple sessions? In other words, the person would need to cancel their initial registration in order to register for a different session?
 
I see that when participants get a registration confirmation email there is an option to edit or cancel their registration details, e.g.:
 
Group M would like to know about cancelations as they happen, so they could offer this seat to others. Do you know if the meeting organizer (in this case it would be me, bc it’d be on my zoom account) is notified participant cancelations as they happen? I just canceled my registration to the GroupM TEST meeting and got this screen:
 
Did you get a notification that I canceled? 
 
Thank you very much!
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her)
